ChatGPT has been accused of exhibiting prejudicial behavior, such as making fun of men and those from England, while refusing to do the same for women and people from India, and giving support to Joe Biden while refraining from doing the same for Donald Trump.

Reviewers praised Keanu Reeves' "Baba Yaga" for its impressive action sequences, although the plot did not warrant the lengthy 3-hour runtime (including a post-credits scene). The movie made over $100 million worldwide when it opened.

This year marked the first time two sequels (Avatar: The Way of Water and Top Gun: Maverick) were included in the Best Picture category of the Academy Awards. Additionally, it was the first time two movies grossing more than one billion dollars worldwide were nominated in the same year.

Gwyneth Paltrow, an award-winning actress and current CEO of Goop, is facing a court case about a skiing accident in 2016. The man who collided with her is seeking millions in compensation, but Paltrow alleges that he was the one who caused the crash.

The International Court of Justice ruled that the United States breached its 1955 treaty with Iran by allowing its domestic courts to freeze the assets of Iranian companies. However, the ICJ said it does not have the authority to manage the $1.75 billion worth of assets the Central Bank of Iran has had frozen.
Brazil and China made an agreement to stop using the US dollar in their trade and instead use their own currencies.

The Vatican disapproves of the discovery doctrine, which 15th-century papal bulls promoted. These documents were used for political gain by colonial powers, allowing them to commit immoral acts against native people without facing any resistance from religious leaders.
Eleven people were crushed to death in a large gathering outside a factory in Karachi, Pakistan. They had been waiting to get food.

India's new income tax has made a considerable change to the 1961 law and includes a contentious "angel tax" section that targets income flowing into the nation from foreign investors who are financing India's start-ups.
The Sacramento Kings, a basketball team, ended their 17-year playoff drought, the longest in the NBA, by qualifying for the playoffs for the first time since 2006.

Ecuador has withdrawn its ambassador from Argentina in protest, as Argentina has refused to provide information about the location of Ecuadorian politician María de los Ángeles Duarte, who has been sheltered there since 2020.
The day after President Emmanuel Macron gave a speech on pension reform, riots broke out in various parts of France.
Poland has announced the closure of a main border crossing with Belarus until further notice due to the escalating tensions between the two nations.

Market research group Kantar Worldpanel reports that grocery inflation in the United Kingdom has hit a new peak of 17.1%. This is due to high inflation, supply chain problems, and rising energy costs which affect the whole economy.
This book is about a baby said to be God's child. He embarks on a quest to discover who he is and his purpose.

Since the 1700s and 1800s, discoveries in many fields, such as planetary science and mammalian biology, have been increasingly more difficult and can be represented by an exponentially decreasing curve.
The pineal gland's history dates back to the ancient Greeks. Subsequent scientific development led to the discovery of its neuroendocrine properties.

The Victorian era saw a surge in industrialisation, which led to a considerable expansion of the middle class. This had a great influence on the social strata, changing the prevailing cultural norms, lifestyle, values, and morality.
The subject and medium of this artwork reflect the progress of modernisation, globalisation, and industrialisation in traditional Bengal, symbolising its energy and the spirit of the era.
The first half of the movie offers great entertainment and keeps viewers enthralled, but the second half is disappointing; it is slow-paced and lacks excitement.
